page.title: 07Changes Since l953
page.content: A new school was built in l965 on land where the W.I. had had their hut. Houses have been built in Hornbeam Close, Stone Pit and Whitlands, also some bungalows for the elderly in Gold Street. Two garden centres have been opened and extended, a new cricket pavilion built, a drag racing strip opened at Santa Pod and a 30 m.p.h speed limit introduced. Many people mentioned the loss of roadmen, a regular bus service and an increase in heavy traffic through Podington. The co-operative shop closed, but a new United Services Club was opened. Footpaths and street lighting have been improved and extended. In the church stonework and the organ have been restored. The parishes of Podington, Hinwick, Farndish and Wymington have been com- bined to form one living.
